User Guide¶

Installation¶

Basic Usage¶

PyFixit requires no setup; merely import the classes you want and construct them:

>>> from pyfixit import Guide
>>> guide = Guide(5)
>>> guide.title
u'Installing PowerBook G3 Wallstreet Processor'

An attempt is made to reduce the number of API calls; thus, many attributes are lazily-fetched on request. To avoid this, use the refresh() method on an object:

>>> from pyfixit import Guide
>>> guide = Guide(5)
>>> guide.title           # Triggers API call.
u'Installing PowerBook G3 Wallstreet Processor'
>>> guide.difficulty      # Already in memory!
u'Easy'

>>> guide = Guide(13682)
>>> guide.refresh()      # Triggers API call.
>>> guide.title          # Already in memory!
u'Oculus Rift Teardown'

refresh() can be called at any time to fetch updates to the object.

Example Application¶

The ifixit-repairability-scores project uses PyFixit to extract repairability scores from iFixit’s teardowns.
